intro: Dissochaeta novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It has opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dissochaeta novoguineensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
